description: John Swift's well-taken strike sets promotion-chasing Swindon on their way to an easy victory over 10-man Notts County.
title: Swindon Town 3-0 Notts County
title_page: Swindon Town 3-0 Notts County - BBC Sport
maintext:
Swindon got their promotion bid back on track as they inflicted a seventh defeat in nine on 10-man Notts County.
After keeper Wes Foderingham twice saved Swindon early on, Chelsea loanee John Swift beat Roy Carroll with a curling shot to put them in front.
Andy Williams doubled the lead from the penalty spot after he was fouled by Carroll before County's Liam Noble was sent off for a second yellow card.
Harry Toffolo sealed the win when he tapped home from close range late on.
The victory saw Swindon bounce back in style from a 3-0 home loss to Gillingham in midweek.
And Mark Cooper's side moved up a place to third in the League One table, with MK Dons fourth after losing at home to Preston, while Notts County dropped a place to 19th.
